message.content:
{"id": "7581", 
"title": "Bug 7581: ComboBoxCellEditor does not size correctly in property sheet", 
"description": "From ECJoe Winchester <JoeWin@us.ibm.com wrote in message news:3C407F76.31A82113@us.ibm.com... ", 
"OB": "The ComboBoxCellEditor in the property sheet does not size correctly when the column width is smaller than the width of the largest item in the list. As a result, the drop down button may be clipped and not visible to the user without expanding the property sheet view. This issue needs to be investigated to determine if it is specific to our implementation or an issue with SWT.", 
"EB": "The ComboBoxCellEditor in the property sheet should always be the width of the column it is placed in. If any of the items in the combo box list is wider than the column, the combo box should adjust its width to accommodate the widest item, while ensuring that the drop down button remains within the visible area of the property sheet.", 
"SR": "The PropertySheetViewer allows editing objects using a set of rows that are name-value pairs displayed in two columns. Each column is defined by an IPropertyDescriptor. I use the createCellEditor() method of IPropertyDescriptor to create editors for the property sheet. In this case, I create a ComboBoxCellEditor with a list of strings. The editor appears in column two of the property sheet, and the drop down button should be visible at the right edge of the column. However, if any string in the list is wider than the column, the combo box expands to accommodate the widest item, causing the drop down button to be clipped. To ensure a good user experience, the combo box should resize to fit the column while keeping the drop down button visible."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '7581', 'title': 'Bug 7581ComboBoxCellEditor does not size correctly in propery sheet', 'description': 'From ECJoe Winchester <JoeWin@us.ibm.com wrote in messagenews:3C407F76.31A82113@us.ibm.com... ', 'OB': '', 'EB': 'I would have expected behavior where the combo box is always the width of the property sheet column.Note that it should work the same DialogCellEditor (Button always visible)Will need to investigate to determine if this is us or SWT. ', 'SR': 'The PropertySheetViewer lets me edit objects using a set of row that are name value pairs in two columns, with each column being defined by an IPropertyDescriptor.IPropertyDescriptor has a method to create a cell editor, and I use this to create editors that include ComboBoxCellEditorconstructor of which can be given the strings.The editor appears in column two of the property sheet and the drop down button appears at the right edge of the column.A problem occurs if any of my strings is wider that the width of the property sheet column.It appears that the combo box grows to be the width of the largest itemthe problem is that the drop down button may now be too far right and off the visible area of the property sheet so it is clipped.From a user experience they can no longer see the combo drop down button without making the property sheet view wider until the button comes into the visible area. '}
